body.p: A Kentucky merchant, banker, businessman, and soldier. Worked as a clerk in the businesses of John J. Dudley and John Carty. Married to Lucy T. Cox Wilgus. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850 and ten in 1860. Freed all enslaved persons after Fort Sumter. Partnered with B. G. Bruce in business from [unknown date] to 1856. Organized the People’s Gas Company of Lexington in 1846. Owned and operated as principal the John B. Wilgus & Company from 1856 to 1866. Elected vice president of the Lexington City National Bank from 1865 to 1870.
